All Classes

  • Class Description
    AbortedTurnException
    This exception is thrown by all methods that are transitively called by the method playTurn() of the Game class, that are also responsible of opening a send/receive communication routine to one or more Clients.
    Activity
    Activitys are performed by Players during their own turn.
    ActivityType
    An enumeration containing the four possible Activity types.
    AlignmentConstraint
    An AlignmentConstraint requires either that two cells are aligned, or that they are not aligned, in order to be eligible for being the Target of an Effect.
    AmmoCell
    AmmoCells are Cells that are able to host an AmmoTile on them.
    AmmoCubes
    This class represents the game's currency.
    AmmoTile
    AmmoTiles are tokens spread on the Cells that are not SpawnCells.
    Assets
    Assets-type Deliverables are used to display with colour the Game status.
    AttackModule
    An AttackModule is an atomic event composing the workflow of a Weapon's AttackPattern.
    AttackPattern
    An AttackPattern is a directional network of AttackModules, fully describing the working process of a Weapon.
    Board
    The Board is the space the game is played on.
    CannotAffordException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to perform a transaction in which the buyer does not have enough AmmoCubes of each colour to afford the cost of the transaction.
    CannotDiscardFirstCardOfDeckException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to discard to a Deck from which the first card has not been drawn yet.
    Cell
    The Cell is the unit of space on the Board.
    CLI
    This class implements GraphicalInterface to allow a Client to be executed via command line interface.
    CliBoard
    This class is responsible of depicting the Board on the CLI interface.
    CliBoard.WallType
    The possible types of walls separating two Cells.
    CliCommon
    This class collects various properties and utility methods for building the coloured CLI interface.
    Client
    This class represent the Client application that is executed.
    ClientAlreadyRegisteredException
    Indicates that an attempt to register a new client has failed because another client with the same identifier has been found into the server.
    ClientCommunicationInterface
    Provides a standardized method to send NetworkMessages from a VirtualClient or any other server-side entity to a client-side entity.
    ClientController
    A ClientController is responsible for the message reception from an RMI remote server.
    ClientLauncher
    This class is used to properly launch a Client application.
    ClientLauncher.Configuration
    The possible configurations in which a Client can be found into.
    ClientNotRegisteredException
    Indicates that an attempt to refer to an unregistered client was made.
    ClientTimeOutException
    Indicates that a Client's time to answer expired before they gave the answer.
    CliPowerUps
    When drawing the Player's hand, this class is responsible of depicting the PowerUp cards.
    CliToasters
    This class is in charge of drawing the small status boards (also known as Toasters) for each Player.
    CliTracks
    This class is used for drawing the killshot track and double-kill track of a Game.
    CliWeapons
    When drawing the Player's hand, this class is responsible of drawing the Weapon cards.
    Color
    This class contains all the possible text colors available via the ANSI escape characters.
    ColoredString
    A ColoredString is like a String but with a colour associated with it.
    ColorPrinter
    This class is a collection of console-like methods to print formatted and coloured messages, and the CLI interface.
    CommunicationHandler
    A CommunicationHandler offers a transparent way to interact with the remote server-side application.
    CommunicationHandler.Interface
    The communication Interface type available to interact with the remote Server.
    CommunicationHub
    A CommunicationHub represents the intermediate class between a ClientCommunicationInterface and the more abstract Player.
    ConnectionException
    Indicates that an error occurred at the network level.
    Constraint
    A constraint is a simple rule that can be verified or falsified.
    ConstraintType
    An enumeration containing the four possible Activity types.
    Controller
    This class controls changes in the status of the Game.
    CountDownTimer
    A Timer class to perform countdown from CountDownTimer.currentSeconds all way down to 0.
    Damage
    Damage is an Effect inflicted to a Player that reduces their health and enables adrenaline actions above certain thresholds.
    Deck<T>
    Decks are ordered collections of objects from which it is only possible to remove, and then read, one object at a time.
    DecoratedJsonArray
    A DecoratedJsonArray is a wrapper class that encapsulates a JSONArray, which is a collection of JSONObjects, and decorates it with methods.
    DecoratedJsonObject
    A DecoratedJsonObject wraps a JSONObject and decorates it with some methods.
    Deliverable
    A Deliverable is a serializable data structure used to wrap and send chunks of information across the net.
    DeliverableEvent
    This enumeration contains all events that could trigger the sending and receiving of a Deliverable.
    DeliverableException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to broadcast to all Client a Deliverable of a type that expects a response.
    DeliverableType
    This enumeration contains all types of Deliverable.
    Delta  
    Dispatcher
    This class offers the final delivery of a message and/or a request to the end user.
    DistanceConstraint
    A DistanceConstraint requires that the distance separating two cells be within a specific interval of values in order for either cell to be eligible for being chosen as a Target.
    Dual
    Dual-type Deliverables are used to convey requests whose answer is dual (i.e.
    Effect
    Effects are consequences of attacks that change a player's status.
    EffectType
    An enumeration containing the four possible Effect types.
    EmptyDeckException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to draw from a Deck without cards.
    Execution
    An Execution is an ordered list of Activitys the Player can perform during their turn.
    FullHandException
    This exception is thrown after giving a Player a card such that the total number of cards of that type in the Player's hand exceeds a set threshold.
    Game
    This class handles at a high level everything concerning the game logic and interfaces with the VirtualView to update VirtualClients on its status, which is in turn modified by the Controller.
    GameAlreadyStartedException
    Indicates that an attempt was made to access a Lobby by a Player while the corresponding Game has already been started.
    GameProperty
    This class contains all the properties needed in order to start a new Game.
    GamePropertyLoader
    This is a utility class used to load the GameProperty from its location into the game.cfg file.
    GameStage  
    Grab
    The Grab Activity is used to collect AmmoCubes from an AmmoCell or buy a Weapon from a SpawnCell's Weapon shop.
    GraphicalInterface
    A GraphicalInterface is an interface used to abstract the user interface layer from the way it is displayed.
    GraphicsManager
    A GraphicsManager is a decorator class of the GraphicalInterface interface.
    GraphicsManager.Interface
    The available graphical interfaces to chose from.
    Grenade
    Grenades allow a player to respond to an attack by dealing 1 Mark to the attacker.
    GUI  
    GUI.Layout  
    IdentityConstraint
    An IdentityConstraint requires either that two Players actually be the same Player, or the opposite, requiring two different identities from the two Players.
    Info
    Info-type Deliverables are used to convey simple information to the user.
    InvalidConstraintTypeException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to instantiate a new Constraint whose type is not in the enumeration of possible ConstraintTypes.
    InvalidEffectTypeException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to instantiate a new Effect whose type is not in the enumeration of possible EffectTypes.
    InvalidFilterInvocationException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to verify a Constraint on an object on which such Constraint has no definition.
    InvalidPasswordException
    Indicates that an invalid password has been used to try to connect to a specified Lobby.
    InvalidPowerUpTypeException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to instantiate a new PowerUp whose type is not in the enumeration of possible PowerUp types.
    InvalidPropertyException
    Indicates that an invalid property was found into the configuration file.
    InvalidSaveStateException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to load a saved Game whose "valid" flag is unset.
    InvalidTargetTypeException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to instantiate a new Target whose type is not in the enumeration of possible TargetTypes.
    JsonException
    This exception is thrown upon a failed attempt to handle an unexpected value from a JSON file.
    JsonObjectGenerator
    This class is a collection of methods, each of which returns a DecoratedJsonObject containing all information needed to build a particular object used in the Game.
    JsonPathGenerator
    This class is used to generated adaptive paths to the .json files.
    JullPointerException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to access a value in a JSON file by using a key not present in the current scope of the file.
    Lobby
    A collection of Players logged together, waiting for a Game to start.
    LobbyAlreadyExistsException
    Indicates that an attempt was made to create a new Lobby with the same identifier of another one already found into the server.
    LobbyCell  
    LobbyEmptyException
    Indicates that an attempt was made to log a Player out from an empty Lobby.
    LobbyFullException
    Indicates that an attempt was made to log a Player into a lobby that has already reached its maximum amount of Players possible.
    LobbyManager
    A wrapper for the Lobby class.
    LobbyNotFoundException
    Indicates that an attempt was made to access a Lobby that no longer exists and cannot be found into the server collection of Lobby.
    Mapped
    Mapped-type Deliverables are sent by the Server to query the Client about multiple-choice questions.
    Mark
    Marks are Effects inflicted to a Player that causes them to take increased Damage the next time they are damaged by the same source as the Mark.
    MessageStatus
    A representation of different states in which a NetworkMessage can be fount.
    MessageType
    This enumeration contains all the possible type of NetworkMessage that can be sent and/or received from all possible entities.
    Move
    The Move Activity is used to change a Player's position to a new position, so long as the distance between the two does not exceed a fixed limit.
    Move
    Moves are Effects inflicted by a Player to themselves or to other Players.
    NetworkMessage
    A NetworkMessage represents the simplest object that flows through the network.
    Newton
    Newtons allow players to Move opponents to a cell in their field of view, provided the distance covered by the opponent does not exceed a set threshold.
    NoValidTargetsException
    This exception is thrown (and caught) internally in the VirtualView, when it is impossible to provide the Player with a valid list of Targets to choose for an attack.
    NullCellOperationException
    This method is thrown when attempting to evaluate any binary predicative or functional method in the class Cell, when passing null as argument.
    Observable
    This interface represents an observable object.
    Observer
    A class can implement the Observer interface when it wants to be informed of changes in Observable objects.
    OffensiveEffect
    Offensive effects are irreversible Effects on players: Damage and Mark.
    OrderConstraint
    An OrderConstraint requires that three cells be aligned and in the order listed.
    Palette  
    Player
    The Player is the main actor of the Game.
    PlayerAlreadyAddedException
    Indicates that an attempt was made to add an already logged Player to the same Lobby more than once.
    PlayerNotFoundException
    Indicates that an attempt was made to refer to a Player that no longer exists on the server.
    PowerUp
    PowerUps are action cards that each Player can use in their turn, before each Execution, during an attack, or during someone else's attack when they're being damaged.
    PowerUpType
    An enumeration containing the four possible PowerUp types.
    Reload
    The Reload Activity allows a Player to reload as many Weapons as they can afford to.
    Response
    Response-type Deliverables are the only ones sent by the client to the Server, and carry with them an integer equivalent to the end user's choice.
    RMIClientCommunicationInterface
    A SocketClientCommunicationInterface offers a transparent way to send NetworkMessages via the RMI protocol.
    RMIController
    An RMIController interface offers a standardized way to notify a class about the presence of a new NetworkMessage that needs to be read and processed.
    RMIServer
    This class is responsible for creating the RMI Registry and binding all the properties needed in order to allow the remote clients to connect to the Server via the RMI protocol.
    RMIServerCommunicationInterface
    An RMIServerCommunicationInterface offers a transparent way to send and receive NetworkMessages via the RMI protocol.
    RMIServerController
    An RMIServerController is a concrete implementation of the RMIController interface.
    Room
    A Room is a collection of Cells grouped by the property of always being visible to one another.
    RoomConstraint
    A RoomConstraint may require that two Rooms be the same in order to satisfy the constraint.
    Scope
    Scopes allow an attacker to deal one additional Damage to one of their targets for each Scope used.
    ScoreList
    This class determines the amount of points a Player hands out to his opponents from whom they took Damage.
    SelfAdjacentCellException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to set a Cell adjacent to itself.
    Server
    The class responsible for the server side infrastructure.
    ServerCommunicationInterface
    Provides a standardized method to send and receive NetworkMessages from a Client entity to a server-side entity.
    ServerLauncher
    This class is used to properly launch a Server application.
    Shoot
    The Shoot Activity allows a Player to use a loaded Weapon in their possession to Damage, Mark and/or Move one or more of their opponents.
    SocketClientCommunicationInterface
    A SocketClientCommunicationInterface offers a transparent way to send NetworkMessages via the Socket protocol.
    SocketClientHandler
    A SocketClientHandler serves the purpose of interfacing with a specific client-side application through a Socket communication protocol.
    SocketServer
    This class is responsible for listening for incoming connections from clients using the Socket protocol.
    SocketServerCommunicationInterface
    A SocketClientCommunicationInterface offers a transparent way to send and receive NetworkMessages via the Socket protocol.
    SpawnCell
    SpawnCells are Cells that Players can choose as spawn points.
    Table
    This is a generic utility class used for smart printing and console formatting.
    Target
    Targets are the actors that have a role in attacks.
    TargetCell  
    TargetInheritanceException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to get a more specific property from a Constraint, than the one it was defined on.
    TargetPlayer  
    TargetRoom  
    TargetType
    An enumeration containing the four possible Target types.
    Teleport
    Teleports allow players to Move to a new position, arbitrarily far away from their current one.
    TestAmmoCubes
    This class tests AmmoCubes methods and constructors.
    TestBoard
    This class tests Board methods.
    TestCell
    This class tests Cell methods.
    TestCountDownTimer
    This class tests the validity of CountDownTimer by stressing it's resistance to multi thread synchronization.
    TestDeck
    This class tests Deck methods.
    TestGame
    This class makes possible an integration test of the Game behaviour.
    TestJson
    This test verifies the functioning JSON reading and writing routines.
    TestLobby
    This class tests the Lobby integrity after certain basic I/O operation are performed.
    TestLobbyManager
    This class tests the LobbyManager integrity after certain operation on the Lobby are asked do be done.
    TestWeapon
    This class tests Weapon methods.
    UnauthoredAttackPatternException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to use an AttackPattern without setting the author Player first.
    UnmatchedSavedParticipantsException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to load a Game but, as far as Player names are concerned, the set of online Players attempting to join the Game and the set of saved Player do not match.
    UTF
    This class is a collection of UTF characters to be used when printing the CLI interface.
    VirtualClient
    A VirtualClient represents the communication layer of a Player.
    VirtualView
    This class is responsible of bridging the network and model packages converting game-related request into Deliverables.
    VisibilityConstraint
    A VisibilityConstraint requires that a cell be visible from another.
    Weapon
    Weapons are a special type of card used by the Player to Move, Damage and Mark other Players.
    WeaponAlreadyLoadedException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to Reload a Weapon that is already reloaded.
    WeaponAlreadyUnloadedException
    This exception is thrown when attempting to unload a Weapon that is already not loaded.
